verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of Agur <S%H94><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jakeh, <S%H3348><s%> the oracle. <S%H9294><s%> The man <S%H1397><s%> declares <S%H5002><s%> to Ithiel, <S%H384><s%> to Ithiel <S%H384><s%> and Ucal: <S%H401><s%>
Surely <S%H3588><s%> I am more <S%H4480><s%> stupid <S%H1198><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> any <S%H376><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> And I do not have the understanding <S%H998><s%> of a man. <S%H120><s%>
Neither <S%H3808><s%> have I learned <S%H3925><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> do I have <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One. <S%H6918><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> has ascended <S%H5927><s%> into heaven <S%H8064><s%> and descended <S%H3381><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> has gathered <S%H622><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> in His fists <S%H2651><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> has wrapped <S%H9503><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> in His garment <S%H8071><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> has established <S%H6965><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>? What <S%H4100><s%> is His name <S%H8034><s%> or His son's name <S%H8034><s%>? Surely <S%H3588><s%> you know! <S%H3045><s%>
Every <S%H3605><s%> word <S%H565><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is tested; <S%H6884><s%> He is a shield <S%H4043><s%> to those who take <S%H2620><s%> refuge <S%H2620><s%> in Him.
Do not add <S%H3254><s%> to His words <S%H1697><s%> Lest <S%H6435><s%> He reprove <S%H3198><s%> you, and you be proved <S%H3576><s%> a liar. <S%H3576><s%>
Two <S%H8147><s%> things <S%H8147><s%> I asked <S%H7592><s%> of Thee, Do not refuse <S%H4513><s%> me before <S%H2962><s%> I die: <S%H4191><s%>

Keep <S%H7368><s%> deception <S%H7723><s%> and lies <S%H3577><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from me, Give <S%H5414><s%> me neither <S%H408><s%> poverty <S%H7389><s%> nor <S%H408><s%> riches; <S%H6239><s%> Feed <S%H2963><s%> me with the food <S%H3899><s%> that is my portion, <S%H2706><s%>

Lest <S%H6435><s%> I be full <S%H7646><s%> and deny <S%H3584><s%> [Thee] and say, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> is the Lord <S%H3068><s%>?" Or lest <S%H6435><s%> I be in want <S%H3423><s%> and steal, <S%H1589><s%> And profane <S%H8610><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of my God. <S%H430><s%>
Do not slander <S%H3960><s%> a slave <S%H5650><s%> to his master, <S%H113><s%> Lest <S%H6435><s%> he curse <S%H7043><s%> you and you be found <S%H816><s%> guilty. <S%H816><s%>
There is a kind <S%H1755><s%> of [man] who curses <S%H7043><s%> his father, And does not bless <S%H1><s%> his mother. <S%H1288><s%>
There is a kind <S%H1755><s%> who is pure <S%H2889><s%> in his own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> Yet is not washed <S%H7364><s%> from his filthiness. <S%H6675><s%>
There is a kind <S%H1755><s%> â€“ oh how <S%H4100><s%> lofty <S%H7311><s%> are his eyes! <S%H5869><s%> And his eyelids <S%H6079><s%> are raised <S%H5375><s%> [in arrogance.]

There is a kind <S%H1755><s%> of [man] whose teeth <S%H8127><s%> are [like] swords, <S%H2719><s%> And his jaw <S%H4973><s%> teeth <S%H4973><s%> [like] knives, <S%H3979><s%> To devour <S%H398><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> from the earth, <S%H776><s%> And the needy <S%H34><s%> from among men. <S%H120><s%>

The leech <S%H5936><s%> has two <S%H8147><s%> daughters, <S%H1323><s%> "Give, <S%H3051><s%>" "Give. <S%H3051><s%>" There <S%H1992><s%> are three <S%H7969><s%> things <S%H7969><s%> that will not be satisfied, <S%H7646><s%> Four <S%H702><s%> that will not say, <S%H559><s%> "Enough <S%H1952><s%>":

Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> and the barren <S%H6115><s%> womb, <S%H7358><s%> Earth <S%H776><s%> that is never <S%H3808><s%> satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with water, <S%H4325><s%> And fire <S%H784><s%> that never <S%H3808><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> "Enough. <S%H1952><s%>"

The eye <S%H5869><s%> that mocks <S%H3932><s%> a father, And scorns <S%H1><s%> <S%H936><s%> a mother, <S%H3349><s%> The ravens <S%H517><s%> of the valley <S%H6158><s%> will pick <S%H5158><s%> it out, And the young <S%H5365><s%> eagles <S%H1121><s%> will eat <S%H5404><s%> it.
There <S%H1992><s%> are three <S%H7969><s%> things <S%H7969><s%> which are too <S%H4480><s%> wonderful <S%H6381><s%> for me, Four <S%H702><s%> which I do not understand: <S%H3045><s%>

The way <S%H1870><s%> of an eagle <S%H5404><s%> in the sky, <S%H8064><s%> The way <S%H1870><s%> of a serpent <S%H5175><s%> on a rock, <S%H6697><s%> The way <S%H1870><s%> of a ship <S%H591><s%> in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> And the way <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H1397><s%> with a maid. <S%H5959><s%>

This <S%H3651><s%> is the way <S%H1870><s%> of an adulterous <S%H5003><s%> woman: <S%H802><s%> She eats <S%H398><s%> and wipes <S%H4229><s%> her mouth, <S%H6310><s%> And says, <S%H559><s%> "I have done <S%H6466><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> wrong. <S%H205><s%>"

Under <S%H8478><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> things <S%H7969><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> quakes, <S%H7264><s%> And under <S%H8478><s%> four, <S%H702><s%> it cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> bear <S%H5375><s%> up:

Under <S%H8478><s%> a slave <S%H5650><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he becomes <S%H4427><s%> king, <S%H4427><s%> And a fool <S%H5036><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he is satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with food, <S%H3899><s%>

Under <S%H8478><s%> an unloved <S%H8130><s%> woman when <S%H3588><s%> she gets <S%H1166><s%> a husband, <S%H1166><s%> And a maidservant <S%H8198><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> she supplants <S%H3423><s%> her mistress. <S%H1404><s%>
Four <S%H702><s%> things <S%H702><s%> are small <S%H6996><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> But they are exceedingly <S%H2449><s%> wise: <S%H2450><s%>
The ants <S%H5244><s%> are not a strong <S%H5794><s%> folk, <S%H5971><s%> But they prepare <S%H3559><s%> their food <S%H3899><s%> in the summer; <S%H7019><s%>
The badgers <S%H9627><s%> are not mighty <S%H6099><s%> folk, <S%H5971><s%> Yet they make <S%H7760><s%> their houses <S%H1004><s%> in the rocks; <S%H5553><s%>
The locusts <S%H697><s%> have <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> Yet all <S%H3605><s%> of them go <S%H3318><s%> out in ranks; <S%H2686><s%>
The lizard <S%H8079><s%> you may grasp <S%H8610><s%> with the hands, <S%H3027><s%> Yet it is in kings' palaces. <S%H1964><s%>

There <S%H1992><s%> are three <S%H7969><s%> things <S%H7969><s%> which are stately <S%H3190><s%> in [their] march, <S%H6806><s%> Even four <S%H702><s%> which are stately <S%H3190><s%> when they walk: <S%H1980><s%>
The lion <S%H3918><s%> [which] is mighty <S%H1368><s%> among beasts <S%H929><s%> And does not retreat <S%H7725><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> any, <S%H3605><s%>
The strutting <S%H2223><s%> <S%H4975><s%> cock, <S%H4975><s%> the male <S%H8495><s%> goat <S%H8495><s%> also, <S%H176><s%> And a king <S%H4428><s%> [when his] army <S%H510><s%> is with him.

If <S%H518><s%> you have been <S%H9310><s%> foolish <S%H9310><s%> in exalting <S%H5375><s%> yourself Or if <S%H518><s%> you have plotted <S%H2161><s%> [evil, put your] hand <S%H3027><s%> on your mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

For the churning <S%H4330><s%> of milk <S%H2461><s%> produces <S%H3318><s%> butter, <S%H2529><s%> And pressing <S%H4330><s%> the nose <S%H639><s%> brings <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> blood; <S%H1818><s%> So the churning <S%H4330><s%> of anger <S%H639><s%> produces <S%H3318><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>
